p.s: The first Actact and the 7th scene from the drama Macbeth, written by Shakespeare is about a dialogue between Macbeth and his wife Lady Macbeth.
They may talk to each other on an evening because they have dinner in the begin of the extract (l. 1).
Lady Macbeth and Macbeth are talking about Macbeth's future title, to be the future King of Scotland, but also about Macbeth's relative, Duncan.
Lady Macbeth tries to convince her husband of murdering King Duncan to save his title and because more than a real man (ll. 25-27).

In the first part (ll. 1-22) they talk about his current title and Lady Macbeth tries to convince him to be not okay with that, that he could be more than just Thane of Cawdor but Macbeth does not want to hear it anand is okay with his job (ll. 20-22).
In the second part (ll. 23-53) Macbeth tries further and further to realize his man he could be more if he does more for him and her.
If he would bring the same sacrifices like she would bring he could be King of Scotland.
Here Macbeth is becoming unsure and he thinks about his wifeswife's plan.
